heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 08 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.9°C) and outside temperature (up 3.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5463 lux) and cloud levels (up 550 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7379 lux), cloud levels (up 871 m), feels like temperature (up 2.7°C), and outside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 550.3m lower than yesterday, 712.4m lower than the past week, 870.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 696m and a high of 1841m, averaging 704.4m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
